DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Sponsor Serious Adverse Event Notification Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator of notification of the group sponsoring a clinical trial that a serious adverse event (SAE) has occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Protocol Sponsor Serious Adverse Event Notification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Notification of the group sponsoring a clinical trial that a serious adverse event (SAE) has occurred.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A protocol is a rule which guides how an activity should be performed; a set of formal rules used to specify the format of an exchange of data.:A person or organization that supports or champions something.

Concepts.definition: A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A person or organization that supports or champions something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product o procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.:Notification; informing by words.

Concepts.definition: Any expected or unexpected adverse event, related or unrelated to the intervention, occurring at any agent dose, any phase of product or procedure testing, that results in any of the following outcomes: death, a life-threatening adverse event, requires inpatient hospitalization (not required as part of the treatment) or prolongation of existing hospitalization, a persistent or significant disability or incapacity, or cancer, or a congenital anomaly or birth defect. Important medical events that may not result in the listed outcomes may be considered as serious when, based upon appropriate medical judgment, they represent significant hazards or potentially serious harm to the research subject or others and may require medical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes listed in this definition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
